subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 08 04

config.question: Why did the United States enter into diplomatic talks with France that would eventually lead to the Louisiana Purchase?

choices.content: The United States feared that Napoleon would use French troops in Haiti to attack U.S. territory.
The United States wanted to buy the port of New Orleans from France.
The United States wanted access to the Pacific Ocean.
The United States wanted to acquire Spanish territory west of the Mississippi River.

answer_3.response: Consider This: In May 1801, prospects for the easy or inevitable acquisition of Louisiana darkened. Jefferson learned that Spain had transferred title to the entire region to France, its powerful northern neighbor. To make matters worse, the French leader Napoleon seemed intent on reestablishing an empire in North America. See L.O. 8.2 How did practical politics challenge Jefferson’s political principles?
